pullRequest.title: [BEAM-10298] beam-linkage-check.sh should not swallow errors
pullRequest.bodyText:
sdks/java/build-tools/beam-linkage-check.sh does not show errors when it fails. It's because it sends errors to dev/null.
#11919 (comment)
Furthermore, the empty invocation to install artifacts to Maven local is no longer required. It was just to make clean text diff in subsequent checkJavaLinkage invocations. We now use XML files to filter existing linkage errors.

Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily:

 Choose reviewer(s) and mention them in a comment (R: @username).
 Format the pull request title like [BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles, where you replace BEAM-XXX with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue.
 Update CHANGES.md with noteworthy changes.
 If this contribution is large, please file an Apache Individual Contributor License Agreement.

See the Contributor Guide for more tips on how to make review process smoother.

commit.message:
Removed empty invocation

Previously, the tool relied on the text diff of the output
of the linkage checker. As we now use the linkage checker exclusion
file to filter existing linkage errors, we don't need to worry
about the garbage in the log output.

nodes.bodyText: This was for clean text diff, which we no longer need.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -72,10 +72,6 @@ function runLinkageCheck () {
   COMMIT=$1
   BRANCH=$2
   MODE=$3 # "baseline" or "validate"
-  # An empty invocation so that the subsequent checkJavaLinkage does not
-  # contain garbage
